description.narrative: Asya Port Liman Isletmeleri A.S. (Asyaport or the Company) is developing a greenfield container terminal (the Project) with an expected annual handling capacity of 1.9 million twenty foot equivalent units that will mostly serve as a transshipment hub to the Black Sea via the Bosphorus.

The Project will help facilitate trade between Black Sea countries, and Mediterranean and further afield countries, by developing a much-needed new, modern and efficient deepwater transshipment container terminal. This is particularly important given the strong growth forecasts for Black Sea countries, especially Turkey. The project will improve the port infrastructure to facilitate Turkey''s growing share of international trade. In addition, the Project will help Turkey realize future gains from developing water transport, which, when compared to road transport, has lower freight rates, more capacity, lower social costs from less road accidents, and less environmental impact. The Project will also create direct and indirect employment opportunities and increase revenues for the Government of Turkey through increased economic activity and higher tax payments, and royalty and lease payments.

mailing-address.narrative: Ahmet Soyuer Asyaport Bahar Sk. No: 2/6 Balmumcu Beikta, 34349 Istanbul Turkey Telephone: +90 (0)212 274 33 96 Fax: +90 (0)212 272 46 69 Website: http://www.asyaport.com

Tom Van Eynde Terminal Investment Limited S.A. Joulehof 16c 4622 RG Bergen op Zoom The Netherlands Telephone: +31(0)164 274 690 Fax: +31(0)164 274 698 Website: http://www.tilgroup.com/ E-mail: mailto:tvaneynde@tilgroup.com

name.narrative: The Project will be located on the Marmara Sea, near the city of Barbaros, Tekirdag Province, Turkey, approximately 70km from Istanbul. It is a deep water site and is strategically located to serve as a transshipment hub for containers destined to the Black Sea via the Bosphorus.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
